master.differenceBetweenStaticAndEditableTempla: Static Templates:Where the templates are created from CRX and there wont be any policies added for static and user cannot add or remove any components from the template
master.whatArePolociesInATemplate: Policies are defined as styles for a Templates.We have container policy where we can group and allow components to one container.We have page policy as we can add styles to our page.
master.whatIsATemplate: Templates are the blue print to create a page.There are 2 types of templates in AEM i.Editable Templates ii.Static Templates

faq_1.differenceBetweenStaticAndEditableTempla: Static Templates:Where the templates are created from CRX and there wont be any policies added for static and user cannot add or remove any components from the template
faq_1.Test:
Page policies are adding styles as top padding and bottom padding to pages

Component policies are allowing the permission to a container add or remove components
faq_1.whatArePolociesInATemplate: Policies are defined as styles for a Templates.We have container policy where we can group and allow components to one container.We have page policy as we can add styles to our page.
faq_1.whatAreStaticTemplates: Static Templates:Where the templates are created from CRX and there wont be any policies added for static and user cannot add or remove any components from the template
faq_1.whatAreTemplateTypes: Template type is the base for creating a template to create a page
faq_1.whatIsATemplate: Templates are the blue print to create a page.There are 2 types of templates in AEM i.Editable Templates ii.Static Templates
faq_1.whereTheTemplatesAreStored: Editable templates are stored under conf/project/wcm/templates
